meanings.definition: laggers: a person or group that lags behind
meanings.sent1: The laggers struggled to keep up with the rest of the team during the race.
meanings.sent2: The laggers at the back of the hiking group enjoyed the scenic views at a slower pace.
meanings.sent3: The laggers in the marathon decided to stop for a picnic halfway through the race.
meanings.sent4: The laggers in the relay race passed the baton smoothly, despite being behind.
meanings.sent5: The laggers in the cycling race pedaled steadily, determined to finish strong.

meanings.definition: laggers: a material used for insulating pipes or vessels
meanings.sent1: The workers applied the laggers to the pipes to prevent heat loss.
meanings.sent2: The laggers were wrapped around the vessel to maintain temperature inside.
meanings.sent3: The laggers on the pipes made them look like they were wearing cozy sweaters.
meanings.sent4: The laggers on the vessel shielded it from extreme temperatures like a protective blanket.
meanings.sent5: The laggers on the pipes kept them warm and snug, like a hug from a friend.

meanings.definition: laggers: a device used to measure the lag of a system
meanings.sent1: The engineers used the laggers to analyze the delay in the system's response.
meanings.sent2: The laggers indicated a slight delay in the data transmission.
meanings.sent3: The laggers beeped loudly whenever there was a lag in the system.
meanings.sent4: The laggers functioned like a stopwatch, measuring the time difference accurately.
meanings.sent5: The laggers displayed the delay in real-time, helping the technicians troubleshoot efficiently.
